attributes.action: Abolish TV Licencing and Increase National Insurance
attributes.background:
The NHS is funded by N. I. which is proportional to earnings.
The BBC is funded by a Licence Fee which costs a minimum of £145 a year.

People are being forced to pay for a non-essential service while an essential one is in dire need of extra funding. 

We must cut off the BBC to save the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
How much the BBC demand:
https://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/pay-for-your-tv-licence/payment-methods/direct-debit-pay1

How much the NHS needs: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

How much the BBC gets:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/licence_fee.html

attributes.action: Review the cases of each of the 3859 prisoners still held under IPP scheme
attributes.background: As of September, 3,859 prisoners were still in custody after being sentenced to an IPP and more than 8/10 were beyond the expiry date of the original sentence. IPP was scrapped in 2012. What they have served is disproportionate to the crimes they have committed.

attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Brexit talks with Romania must proceed ONLY when cruelty to stray animals ceases
attributes.background: Theresa May must gain the unconditional agreement of the Romanian Government to cease the barbaric treatment of animals in their public shelters before Brexit negotiations commence. As a nation of animal lovers the UK should not partner with a country whose government publicly condones such cruelty.
attributes.additional_details: ‘Bid to Save a Stray’ is a Registered Charity who rescue and rehome Romanian dogs and cats in peril. Cruelly caught by uncaring public workers, the animals are left suffering, often within barbaric cages with no food, water or medical treatment for painful injuries sustained. The majority are then killed inhumanely within a period of time too short to allow interjection by those willing to help. The horrific treatment of innocent strays must end before we commence any trade negotiations.

attributes.action: All income used by self funders to pay for care needs should not be taxed.
attributes.background: Phase Two of the Care Act 2014 has been delayed, resulting in self funders having to finance care needs until their assets, including the value of the family home, fall below £23,500.  The Act included a cap on the maximum fees that could be paid. Tax relief on income for this purpose would be fair.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government Care Act Fact Sheets state: 

"These reforms aim to give everyone the peace of mind that they will be protected from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap on care costs." 

Also "The cap will limit the amount people have to pay towards the cost of their eligible care and support over their lifetime."

Delay in implementation does not protect people receiving care “from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap”.

attributes.action: Urge Volkswagen to compensate owners of cars with emission defeat devices
attributes.background: In the US, Volkswagen have to pay $5100 to each owner affected and the owners get the option of buyback by Volkswagen of the vehicle or to wait for VW to develope a fix that can win regulatory approval.
attributes.additional_details: Emission "defeat devices" are a software Volkswagen knowingly installed in its cars to fool emission testing machines into thinking that the car is safer than it is. The software actually allows the cars affected to emit up to 40 times the legally allowable pollution, whilst cheating at the MOT emission test so that it passes. The scandal has also damaged the resale value of affected cars and as such I think it a travesty that Volkswagen do not pay compensation to owners

attributes.action: Transfer SouthEastern and Southern services to TfL from 2018 onwards
attributes.background: This petition demands that management and accountability for London's failing Metro services is handed over to TfL and operated under London Overground. Starting with 2018 SouthEastern services to and from Dartford followed by Southern services and others as and when current franchises expire.
attributes.additional_details: Chris Grayling MP has rejected the Mayor of London's proposal to allow TfL to take full control over the failing Southern and SouthEastern franchises when they expire. The London Overground unit has a proven track record of improving punctuality, cleanliness, staffing levels and frequency. Profits are reinvested into the network meaning that services are run for the benefit of passengers. Chris Grayling made a mess of our prisons - we need to stop him doing the same to our transport.

attributes.action: Ban plastic staws or introduce a 5p charge for each one.
attributes.background: To help cut down on the amount of single use disposable plastics. As whether they are put in the bin or thrown on the floor the toxic chemicals still leak into our oceans and damage/kill marine life.

attributes.action: Cap the limit on private hire vehicles plated in the UK
attributes.background: Far too many private hire vehicles on the road in the UK It has stop people making a living wage and now a danger to the public as drivers have to work over 90 hours a wage to able to pay the overheads and feed there familys to many drivers have no idea where there go or know how to drive safely
attributes.additional_details: Since most council have do away with a test for drivers to see if they know the area they are to work in and have let cross boarder hiring it has put the public in danger as driver who cant read or speak english and dont know the road signs or highway code and donot get the correct dbr checks has made this pratices unfare to drivers who have done all the things set out before the tests were done away with and are now struggling to make a living

attributes.action: Where a partner dies before Retirement Age,transfer pension to Partner,for 5yrs
attributes.background: As part of the social care package I would propose that all persons whose life companion, partner, spouse, Husband or Wife died before that reached the stipulated Retirement Age to receive their partners pension, non-means-tested, for a period of Five years after the date of the loved one.
attributes.additional_details: This would also ease the burden on social care and health and be a clear signal of a Steadfast commitment to tackle the crisis of pensioner poverty, social care, and relive the impossible burden upon our NHS

attributes.action: End the ban on the creation of new grammar schools
attributes.background: Planned expansions of existing grammar schools will not be enough to address educational inequality; bright children who live nowhere near to a potential expanded grammar school are being failed.  The ban on the creation of new grammar schools must be repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
Your postcode should not determine your quality of education. Yet the gulf between the worst and best state schools is large and for many, private school is not an option. This has created severe educational inequality, which academic selection will help to address.

Grammar schools should be a top priority in improving opportunities for bright, poorer students. The government should allow the creation of new grammar schools to widen access to a rigorous, traditional and academic education.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into DEFRA's handling of Bird Flu 2016/17
attributes.background: Defra have failed to provide timely, clear & consistent info to poultry keepers and the general public throughout the prevention zone and outbreak period.
attributes.additional_details: The law relating to lockdown requirements is vague.  Defra/Apha/Trading Standards representatives are issuing conflicting information when questions have been raised. The general public have received minimal information via the media, any information has been actively sought by those with online access and a passing knowledge of the situation. We (the public) have many questions that require clear answers.

attributes.action: Lower the age of free childcare care from 3 to 2 to support working families
attributes.background: In the UK, childcare is provided for working families at the age of 3 which means that from a young age, working families need to pay up to £40 a day for childcare. For full timers this equates to £800 per month. More than the average mortgage payment.
attributes.additional_details: For non working families childcare is provided for free of charge. This is a backwards system as why would someone who doesn't work need their child watched full time. Where as some one who is working has to pay for their child care and receives no support.

attributes.action: Remove status from charities paying staff more than 3 times the average wage.
attributes.background: Charities in the UK should have their charitable status removed if they pay any of their staff more than three times the average wage. Why should a pensioner on less than £150 a week give £5 to a charity that pays a CEO £200k? In 2016-2017 three times the average wage is £82,500. Many get more.
attributes.additional_details: By way of examples - Parkinson's UK has 10 staff earning between £60,000 and £130,000, The Royal British Legion has 26 staff earning between £60,000 and £160,000, Help for Heroes has 17 staff earning between £60,000 and £110,000 and Cancer Research UK has 219 staff earning between £60,000 and £250,000.

attributes.action: Fully adopt the metric system
attributes.background: The UK has had a mix of measurements for about 50 years when the government committed to converting to the metric system in the late 60s, but the conversion slowed and is still continuing to this day. We should fully adopt the metric system, as it is an international system used by 192/195 countries
attributes.additional_details:
Food/drink is sold in grams/litres except milk and beer which is sold in pints. Fuel is sold in litres but efficiency is in mpg. Vehicles measurements are in metres but warning signs show feet/inches. Road signs are in miles/yards but motorway marker posts are in kilometres. A consistent system prevents confusion but also creates an international system understood by people from all cultures. The government should finish conversion to metric by converting road signs to kilometres (as planned in the 70s). Ireland proved this was done smoothly and at low cost in 2005. The metric system has been used in schools for over 40 years so full adoption wouldn't cause confusion as most people have learned it.
http://www.metric.org.uk/

attributes.action: Halt Brexit process & seek legally binding mandate from public post-Trump
attributes.background: The recent change in the US government administration and their subsequent rhetoric and actions have placed the UK in a perilous negotiating position during the Brexit process. Reality of Brexit is also more well defined than pre-referendum meaning public opinion may have changed significantly.
attributes.additional_details: Following the election of Mr. Trump and the subsequent change in US government administration, the US has changed position on numerous issues, with controversy following certain actions too numerous to mention here. We are specifically concerned with where this leaves the UK in our Brexit negotiations given HM Government's timetable for withdrawal, in light of the overwhelming disquiet shown over aligning ourselves with the new US administration against the relative stability of EU membership.

attributes.action: Prevent MPs having second jobs outside Parliament or Government
attributes.background:
Representing your constituency in parliament should be an MP's full time job. 

Taking on lucrative second or in some cases third jobs outside politics can only mean less time working for their constituents and the country. This should be banned.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for building companies to have indemnity insurance
attributes.background: This is to protect consumers against rogue traders, not finishing work, doing incorrect and unsafe work then closing that business down and the consumer unable to claim  any monies back from the builder. This way consumers could then claim against their insurance.

attributes.action: free bus pass from the age of 60 for people living in England
attributes.background: People living in Scotland,Wales,N Ireland,and even London,can get a free bus pass.I feel that it discriminates against people living in England.

attributes.action: Establish a cross-party Constitutional Convention on European membership.
attributes.background: The BREXIT referendum was a crude method of gauging political opinion. The outcome has been highly divisive. We now need a more sophisticated mechanism for determining what our relationship with Europe should be. We cannot leave this in the hands of a single political faction.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland successfully used a Constitutional Convention to determine 'the settled will of the people' on the matter of devolution. This should have been the UK's approach to BREXIT, but wasn't. Now, we must build consensus, taking account of the concerns of citizens from all four nations, young and old, living here and abroad. And we urgently need to agree which principles and values, which individual and collective rights will be safeguarded in any forthcoming negotiations with Europe.

attributes.action: Ensure fracking is not allowed near Sherwood Forest
attributes.background:
Following a Guardian article (see link below) we would like to ensure that Ineos and any other company is not allowed to begin fracking near the historic site of the Major Oak in Sherwood Forest. 

(https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/01/robin-hoods-sherwood-forest-faces-fracking-threat)

attributes.action: Abolish employment tribunal fees.
attributes.background: We call on the Conservative Government to abolish tribunal fees which were introduced in 2013 which are severely hindering access to justice especially for those who are vulnerable.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Interpol, to enforce against the illegal trading of Chimps.
attributes.background: The heart-breaking BBC article (see below) details how easy it is for baby chimps to be traded illegally across waters. Putting pressure on and educating Interpol and Customs, could help more cases be uncovered and having a more severe punishment may act as a deterrent.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/resources/idt-5e8c4bac-c236-4cd9-bacc-db96d733f6cf

attributes.action: Car tax exemption for cars over 30 years old
attributes.background: Classic cars between 30 and 40 years old have to be Taxed. There needs to be more of an incentive for owners to keep these cars going. Many cars of this age are in need of restoration, they are likely uneconomical to repair. This is the way forward to encourage the protection of classic cars

attributes.action: Make it Compulsory for Bus/Taxi Road lanes Surfaces be Colour Coded
attributes.background: Don't you hate it when you're away from home in unfamiliar surroundings then drive down a Bus/Taxi Land not knowing because it's not displayed properly then getting a fine.
attributes.additional_details: Get road surface colour coded where necessary

attributes.action: Require the final Brexit deal with the EU to be approved by the UK Parliament
attributes.background:
The formal process of negotiating the exit of the UK from the EU includes 'consent' by MEPs in the European Parliament to the final deal. MPs in the UK Parliament should be afforded the same right as well.
If the UK Parliament fails to consent to the final Brexit deal, the UK should stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The Constitutional Reform and Governance Act 2010 details requirements around International Treaties being put before Parliament, prior to ratification.  The Government has yet to confirm its intention in this regard in respect of the final Brexit deal with the EU. (This is despite repeated requests for clarification by the Select Committee for Exiting the EU).

The UK Parliament is sovereign and its endorsement of the final Brexit deal should be required before ratification and implementation.

attributes.action: Please give extra money to keep our Isle of Wight acute inpatient hospital open.
attributes.background: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Sustainability and Transformation Plan [HIOW STP] has been published. The plan is to reduce overall running costs in the area. But we might lose 300 hospital beds. Acutely ill Isle of Wight patients need inpatient facilities near to home, not "ferried to the mainland".
attributes.additional_details: https://onthewight.com/petitions-protect-health-services-on-the-isle-of-wight-gaining-support/

attributes.action: Change the law so fathers get equal rights over their children!
attributes.background: Fathers should have just as many rights over a child as the mother!! These days and ages men and woman are classed as equals so where their children are concerned then so should shared parental rights be equal!! Unless there is very good reason. not to.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it that the mother is 100% sided for over the child, why does the law always side for the mother, and why can a woman be enabled to lie about the circumstances and go to great lengths to stop the father seeing his child? 

If accusations are made then this should be proved and backed up 100% before any decision is made! 

And how do mothers get away with not putting a father on the birth certificate knowing full well who the child's father is!!!

This should be against the law.

attributes.action: Abolish road tax increase until road conditions are improved
attributes.background: Action should be taken as we are currently paying road tax, which is set to increase in the near future, when the condition of roads is appalling. So why increase it? What do we currently pay road tax for and where is our money going?

attributes.action: Ban pictures of children from online dating/sexual encounter profiles
attributes.background: At present it isn't illegal to put pictures of your children on dating websites/apps intended to facilitate sexual meets. There is nothing the police or social services can do if this occurs and persons use pictures of their children to aid their dating breaching the child's rights/privacy+safety.
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother who has recently had her children recognised in the street due to the father using pics of the children on online sex apps I want change.

I have spoken to the police and social services and it isn't an offence to use pictures on these post 18 sites.

It is illegal for children to have social media yet parents can put them in the public domain to help obtain sexual partners.

Legally! Please can we act together to get this discussed in parliament - children's safety is critical!

attributes.action: “That there shall be an early parliamentary general election.”
attributes.background: To remedy the uncertainty caused by the outcome of the Referendum on U. K. membership of the European Union, that the House of Commons have a motion laid before it by the end of March 2017 “That there shall be an early parliamentary general election.”
attributes.additional_details: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011 provides for this, and if passed by a two-thirds majority, it is the only way for a general election to be held earlier than May 2020, other than a motion of no confidence in HMG passed by a simple majority.

attributes.action: All NHS Ambulance, Police & Fire vehicles and uniforms to display the Union flag
attributes.background: After the events in London this week we are reminded that our emergency services play a vital role in the frontline of combating and responding to national crisis. Like our armed forces they should wear with pride the union standard (Union Jack) flag as a symbol of pride and unity.

attributes.action: Make it law that all TV channels and DVDs etc must have the option of subtitles.
attributes.background: I'm profoundly deaf. It's annoying for me and other deaf people, that we can't enjoy some TV and DVDs/ blu-rays etc. the same as everyone else because companies can't be bothered to put subtitles on them, especially older, classic films and TV shows. There should always be the option of subtitles.

attributes.action: Change the definition of rape to cover forceful envelopment of a penis or digit
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 defines rape as the penetration of the vagina, anus or mouth of another person with a penis. By this definition, a woman cannot rape a man or another woman. The law should be changed to include the forceful envelopment of a penis or digit

attributes.action: Take into account the other parent's wage when calculating CSA payments.
attributes.background: When calculating Child maintenance payments, it should not just be based on the one wage of who is paying the maintenance. The other parent's wage should be taken into account, and adjusted accordingly so payments are fair and the children benefit from being with both parents.
attributes.additional_details: Personally all CSA payments should be in the form of food and clothing tickets or something a long those lines, so that all parties know that the children's welfare is being taken care of and not being spent on anything that isn't for the children.

attributes.action: Give free public transport to homeless people in UK
attributes.background: Whilst we find ways and seek solutions to Homelessness it would be a good start by offering access to public transport. This way we would offer them some respite and support that they need in order to improve their lives. Moreover, it would not cost us much as it is already there.
attributes.additional_details:
In the current climate Homelessness is rising and there are no easy solutions to this. Local Authorities are struggling to cope with the demand and are not able to house most people registered as Homeless due to the lack of Housing supply.

We believe that it would be only just fair that as a great country, United Kingdom would allow anyone who is registered as Homeless to have free public transport. This would enable them to go to work, attend job centres, hospital or housing appointments.

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Empower the Police to seize and destroy Mobile Phones
attributes.background: So many people are killed or injured every week as a result of road traffic accidents where mobile phone distraction is the cause. Please sign & support this petition. you will be saving lives!

attributes.action: Have sufferers of mental health problems seen by services before it's critical
attributes.background: After waiting for months to be referred to any kind of mental health service as I wasn't 'critical enough', my weight had dropped to less than 5 stone and my depression was at an all time low. I want all suffers of mental health problems to be seen by services before they reach a critical point.
attributes.additional_details: More than one in ten (12%) people with mental health problems are stuck on waiting lists for over a year before receiving talking treatments and over half (54%) wait over three months, reveals a new report launched by the We Need to Talk coalition of which the mental health charity Mind is part of. By reaching 100k signatures this issue will be considered for debate in parliament and hopefully more funds can be put into helping individuals get the help they need before it's critical.

attributes.action: Please open Reading Prison to Soup Kitchens & support grouos helping homeless.
attributes.background: Reading prison is currently empty. All we ask is whilst it is, can it be used by soup kitchens and support groups that help our Homeless community. They can have a bed, be in the warm and have use of the kitchens where they can have a hot meal.

attributes.action: In the next Scottish independence referendum Scots ex-pats must be given a vote.
attributes.background: Many people that were born in Scotland now live abroad but still have a heavily vested interest in the future of Scotland. They may own property, run businesses and employ people here. Many will intend to return to Scotland. To deny them a vote in Scotland's future would be unfair and undemocratic.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister determines whether or not a second referendum will take place. In the event that she decides that it should, we petition her to make it a condition of the referendum that ex-patriot Scots who were born in Scotland should be allowed a vote.

attributes.action: Make All Highway Contracts Fix Pot Holes Within 150 Meters Of Active Roadworks.
attributes.background:
We are all sick of hitting pot holes and getting stuck or slowed down by roadworks. 

We want to make it law that any company who closes off a highway , must repair any pothole within 150 meters of the closure.

attributes.action: Stop non-medically qualified persons administering dermal filler.
attributes.background: The aesthetics industry is poorly regulated and the number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections in the UK is growing rapidly. Concern lies mainly with theses individual's ability to assess appropriately as well as recognise and manage complications as and when they arise.
attributes.additional_details: Health professionals in the U.K are concerned about the growing number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections. Anyone can train, get insurance and start injecting members of the public with these substances. There are substantial risks associated with these treatments and whilst doctors and nurses are regulated by their own professional bodies, non-medics are not. They are not regulated or professionally accountable.

attributes.action: Delay the April 2017 VED (Car Tax) changes until a better idea is proposed
attributes.background: The 2017 changes will damage the car industry and buyer of both new and used cars from April 2017. The changes do nothing to encourage manufacturers to improve efficiency and do nothing to encourage buyers to buy more fuel and emissions efficient cars. Changes are a retrograde step
attributes.additional_details:
The details of the new rates are available on gov website - https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/534511/ved-reform-briefing-for-motor-industry.pdf
This change increases costs for drivers ;
First year tax from £0 for cars between 1 and 130g/km CO2 to between £10 and £160.  
It increases annual cost for these cars from £20-£110 to £140 for all
Adds a £310 premium on top where list price is over £40,000. This lasts 5 years so affects the used car market also.

attributes.action: Convicted paedophile/sex offender should not be allowed to possess child images.
attributes.background: In 2014, an individual was convicted due to having 4000 indecent images/videos of children. This person is allowed to photograph, with long lens, children and upload pictures to the internet without parents consent. He is on the sex offenders register.
attributes.additional_details: Any individual who is a convicted paedophile or sex offender should not be allowed to own/have in their possession any media content of children's images, whether the child is clothed/partially clothed or naked. This includes pictures, images on a computer, laptop, memory stick, camera or any other media device that can hold images.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for ALL betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: It should be the responsibility of the company to ensure all safety measures available are utilised to protect staff at all times. Staff safety needs to be taken  seriously and should take priority over the cost of installing preventative measures
attributes.additional_details: Many staff will feel the benefit of feeling safe in their working environment. It is not physically or mentally healthy to work in unsafe conditions. We need protecting and we need our employers to take responsibility and to take immediate action.

attributes.action: Change the child tax credits from two children to four.
attributes.background: Lower income families and working families on low income need the extra help. Not many families have just two children and some people are now pregnant and at risk of miscarriage due to the stress of money worries.

attributes.action: Ensure the Royal Navy does not lose its long-range anti-ship missile capability
attributes.background:
The MoD has admitted that the Royal Navy's Harpoon anti-ship missile will go out of service in 2018 with no replacement specified. The shorter range Sea Skua missile also goes out of service, not to be replaced until 2020.

This means the Royal Navy will lack a ship-killing capability for sometime
attributes.additional_details:
Rear-Adml Chris Parry, said: "It's a significant capability gap and the Government is being irresponsible. It just shows that our warships are for the shop window and not for fighting."

Lord West of Spithead, a former First Sea Lord, said: “This is just another example of where the lack of money is squeezing and making the nation less safe. We will have this gap of several years without missiles. Well, that’s fine if you don’t have to fight anybody in the meantime.”

attributes.action: giving a parking tickets to a carer or nurse on call illegal in permit areas.
attributes.background: Carers and nurses in the community often arrive at a clients house only to find that it is a permit road only and all other surrounding roads have no space to park. So the nurse or carer decides to put the client 1st and park wherever they can to help the person in need.
attributes.additional_details: When a person is in need of a little help there are people there to help. The carers and nurses who help, struggle on a daily basis to park their cars to get to the client often driving round for 10 minutes to find somewhere to park. This time spent driving round trying to park their car could be put to better use of the struggling demand of people in need of help or assistance. Carers and nurses should be allocated a badge to stop the parking tickets when working.

attributes.action: Terrorism offence to carry a minimum 15 year jail term!
attributes.background: Any offence of terrorism or terrorist activities to carry a jail term of 15 years minimum
